types.name: AmountInput
types.description: `AmountInput` is a range of token quantities to filter by.

inputFields.name: from
inputFields.description: The minimum quantity of tokens to check for.

inputFields.name: to
inputFields.description: The maximum quantity of tokens to check for.

inputFields.name: denomination
inputFields.description:
Filter by token's denomination.
If set to an empty string, it will get an empty value.

types.name: BankMsgSend
types.description:
`BankMsgSend` is a message with a message router of `bank` and a message type of `send`.
`BankMsgSend` is the fund transfer tx message.

fields.name: from_address
fields.description:
the bech32 address of the fund sender.
ex) `g1jg8mtutu9khhfwc4nxmuhcpftf0pajdhfvsqf5`

fields.name: to_address
fields.description:
the bech32 address of the fund receiver.
ex) `g1jg8mtutu9khhfwc4nxmuhcpftf0pajdhfvsqf5`

fields.name: amount
fields.description:
the denomination and amount of fund sent ("<amount><denomination>").
ex) `1000000ugnot`

types.name: BankMsgSendInput
types.description: `BankMsgSendInput` represents input parameters required when the message type is `send`.

inputFields.name: from_address
inputFields.description:
the bech32 address of the fund sender.
You can filter by the fund sender address.
ex) `g1jg8mtutu9khhfwc4nxmuhcpftf0pajdhfvsqf5`

inputFields.name: to_address
inputFields.description:
the bech32 address of the fund receiver.
You can filter by the fund receiver address.
ex) `g1jg8mtutu9khhfwc4nxmuhcpftf0pajdhfvsqf5`

inputFields.name: amount
inputFields.description:
the denomination and amount of fund sent ("<amount><denomination>").
ex) `1000000ugnot`

types.name: Block
types.description: Represents a blockchain block with various attributes detailing its creation and content.

fields.name: height
fields.description:
A unique identifier for the Block determined by its position in the blockchain.
This integer is strictly increasing with each new Block.

fields.name: version
fields.description:
The software version of the node that created this Block, indicating the specific
implementation and versioning of the blockchain protocol used.

fields.name: chain_id
fields.description:
An identifier for the specific blockchain network this Block belongs to. Helps in
distinguishing between different networks like mainnet, testnet, etc.

fields.name: time
fields.description: The timestamp at which this Block was proposed and finalized in the blockchain. Represented in UTC.

fields.name: proposer_address_raw
fields.description:
Encoded data representing the blockchain address of the proposer who submitted this Block.
It is raw and requires decoding to be human-readable.

types.name: BlockFilter
types.description: Filters for querying Blocks within specified criteria related to their attributes.

inputFields.name: from_height
inputFields.description: Minimum block height from which to start fetching Blocks, inclusive. If unspecified, there is no lower bound.

inputFields.name: to_height
inputFields.description: Maximum block height up to which Blocks should be fetched, exclusive. If unspecified, there is no upper bound.

inputFields.name: from_time
inputFields.description: Minimum timestamp from which to start fetching Blocks, inclusive. Blocks created at or after this time will be included.

inputFields.name: to_time
inputFields.description: Maximum timestamp up to which to fetch Blocks, exclusive. Only Blocks created before this time are included.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as "4") or integer (such as 4) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: MemFile
types.description: `MemFile` is the metadata information tied to a single gno package / realm file

fields.name: name
fields.description: the name of the source file.

fields.name: body
fields.description: the content of the source file.

types.name: MemFileInput
types.description: `MemFileInput` is the metadata information tied to a single gno package / realm file.

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: the name of the source file.

inputFields.name: body
inputFields.description: the content of the source file.

types.name: MemPackage
types.description: `MemPackage` is the metadata information tied to package / realm deployment.

fields.name: name
fields.description: the name of the package.

fields.name: path
fields.description: the gno path of the package.

fields.name: files
fields.description: the associated package gno source.

types.name: MemPackageInput
types.description: `MemPackageInput` represents a package stored in memory.

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: the name of the package.

inputFields.name: path
inputFields.description: the gno path of the package.

inputFields.name: files
inputFields.description: the associated package gno source.

types.name: MessageRoute
types.description:
`MessageRoute` is route type of the transactional message.
`MessageRoute` has the values of vm and bank.

types.name: MessageType
types.description:
`MessageType` is message type of the transaction.
`MessageType` has the values `send`, `exec`, `add_package`, and `run`.

enumValues.name: send
enumValues.description:
The route value for this message type is `bank`, and the value for transactional messages is `BankMsgSend`.
This is a transaction message used when sending native tokens.

enumValues.name: exec
enumValues.description:
The route value for this message type is `vm`, and the value for transactional messages is `MsgCall`.
This is a transaction message that executes a function in realm or package that is deployed in the GNO chain.

enumValues.name: add_package
enumValues.description:
The route value for this message type is `vm`, and the value for transactional messages is `MsgAddPackage`.
This is a transactional message that adds a package to the GNO chain.

enumValues.name: run
enumValues.description:
The route value for this message type is `vm`, and the value for transactional messages is `MsgRun`.
This is a transactional message that executes an arbitrary Gno-coded TX message.

types.name: MsgAddPackage
types.description:
`MsgAddPackage` is a message with a message router of `vm` and a message type of `add_package`.
`MsgAddPackage` is the package deployment tx message.

fields.name: creator
fields.description:
the bech32 address of the package deployer.
ex) `g1jg8mtutu9khhfwc4nxmuhcpftf0pajdhfvsqf5`

fields.name: package
fields.description: the package being deployed.

fields.name: deposit
fields.description:
the amount of funds to be deposited at deployment, if any ("<amount><denomination>").
ex) `1000000ugnot`

types.name: MsgAddPackageInput
types.description: `MsgAddPackageInput` represents input parameters required when the message type is `add_package`.

inputFields.name: creator
inputFields.description:
the bech32 address of the package deployer.
You can filter by the package deployer's address.
ex) `g1jg8mtutu9khhfwc4nxmuhcpftf0pajdhfvsqf5`

inputFields.name: package
inputFields.description: the package being deployed.

inputFields.name: deposit
inputFields.description:
the amount of funds to be deposited at deployment, if any ("<amount><denomination>").
ex) `1000000ugnot`

types.name: MsgCall
types.description:
`MsgCall` is a message with a message router of `vm` and a message type of `exec`.
`MsgCall` is the method invocation tx message.

fields.name: caller
fields.description:
the bech32 address of the function caller.
ex) `g1jg8mtutu9khhfwc4nxmuhcpftf0pajdhfvsqf5`

fields.name: send
fields.description:
the amount of funds to be deposited to the package, if any ("<amount><denomination>").
ex) `1000000ugnot`

fields.name: pkg_path
fields.description: the gno package path.

fields.name: func
fields.description: the function name being invoked.

fields.name: args
fields.description: `args` are the arguments passed to the executed function.

types.name: MsgCallInput
types.description: `MsgCallInput` represents input parameters required when the message type is `exec`.

inputFields.name: caller
inputFields.description:
the bech32 address of the function caller.
You can filter by the function caller's address.
ex) `g1jg8mtutu9khhfwc4nxmuhcpftf0pajdhfvsqf5`

inputFields.name: send
inputFields.description:
the amount of funds to be deposited to the package, if any ("<amount><denomination>").
ex) `1000000ugnot`

inputFields.name: pkg_path
inputFields.description: the gno package path.

inputFields.name: func
inputFields.description: the function name being invoked.

inputFields.name: args
inputFields.description:
`args` are the arguments passed to the executed function.
The arguments are checked in the order of the argument array and
if they are empty strings, they are excluded from the filtering criteria.
ex) `["", "", "1"]` <- Empty strings skip the condition.

types.name: MsgRun
types.description:
`MsgRun` is a message with a message router of `vm` and a message type of `run`.
`MsgRun is the execute arbitrary Gno code tx message`.

fields.name: caller
fields.description:
the bech32 address of the function caller.
ex) `g1jg8mtutu9khhfwc4nxmuhcpftf0pajdhfvsqf5`

fields.name: send
fields.description:
the amount of funds to be deposited to the package, if any ("<amount><denomination>").
ex) `1000000ugnot`

fields.name: package
fields.description: the package being executed.

types.name: MsgRunInput
types.description: `MsgRunInput` represents input parameters required when the message type is `run`.

inputFields.name: caller
inputFields.description:
the bech32 address of the function caller.
You can filter by the function caller's address.
ex) `g1jg8mtutu9khhfwc4nxmuhcpftf0pajdhfvsqf5`

inputFields.name: send
inputFields.description:
the amount of funds to be deposited to the package, if any ("<amount><denomination>").
ex) `1000000ugnot`

inputFields.name: package
inputFields.description: the package being executed.

types.name: Query
types.description: Root Query type to fetch data about Blocks and Transactions based on filters or retrieve the latest block height.

fields.name: transactions
fields.description: Retrieves a list of Transactions that match the given filter criteria. If the result is incomplete due to errors, both partial results and errors are returned.

fields.name: blocks
fields.description: Fetches Blocks matching the specified filter criteria. Incomplete results due to errors return both the partial Blocks and the associated errors.

fields.name: latestBlockHeight
fields.description: Returns the height of the most recently processed Block by the blockchain indexer, indicating the current length of the blockchain.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String`scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: Subscription
types.description:
Subscriptions provide a way for clients to receive real-time updates about Transactions and Blocks based on specified filter criteria.
Subscribers will only receive updates for events occurring after the subscription is established.

fields.name: transactions
fields.description:
Subscribes to real-time updates of Transactions that match the provided filter criteria.
This subscription starts immediately and only includes Transactions added to the blockchain after the subscription is active.

This is useful for applications needing to track Transactions in real-time, such as wallets tracking incoming transactions
or analytics platforms monitoring blockchain activity.

Returns:
- Transaction: Each received update is a Transaction object that matches the filter criteria.

fields.name: blocks
fields.description:
Subscribes to real-time updates of Blocks that match the provided filter criteria. Similar to the Transactions subscription,
this subscription is active immediately upon creation and only includes Blocks added after the subscription begins.

This subscription is ideal for services that need to be notified of new Blocks for processing or analysis, such as block explorers,
data aggregators, or security monitoring tools.

Returns:
- Block: Each update consists of a Block object that satisfies the filter criteria, allowing subscribers to process or analyze new Blocks in real time.

types.name: Time
types.description: Field representing a point on time. It is following the RFC3339Nano format ("2006-01-02T15:04:05.999999999Z07:00")

types.name: Transaction
types.description: Defines a transaction within a block, detailing its execution specifics and content.

fields.name: index
fields.description: A sequential index representing the order of this Transaction within its Block. Unique within the context of its Block.

fields.name: hash
fields.description: Hash from Transaction content in base64 encoding.

fields.name: success
fields.description: The success can determine whether the transaction succeeded or failed.

fields.name: block_height
fields.description: The height of the Block in which this Transaction is included. Links the Transaction to its containing Block.

fields.name: gas_wanted
fields.description: The declared amount of computational effort the sender is willing to pay for executing this Transaction.

fields.name: gas_used
fields.description: The actual amount of computational effort consumed to execute this Transaction. It could be less or equal to `gas_wanted`.

fields.name: content_raw
fields.description: The payload of the Transaction in a raw format, typically containing the instructions and any data necessary for execution.

fields.name: messages
fields.description:
The payload of a message shows the contents of the messages in a transaction.
A message consists of `router`, `type`, and `value` (whose form depends on the `router` and `type`).

fields.name: memo
fields.description:
`memo` are string information stored within a transaction.
`memo` can be utilized to find or distinguish transactions.
For example, when trading a specific exchange, you would utilize the memo field of the transaction.

fields.name: response
fields.description:
`response` is the processing result of the transaction.
It has `log`, `info`, `error`, and `data`.

types.name: TransactionBankMessageInput
types.description: `TransactionBankMessageInput` represents input parameters required when the message router is `bank`.

inputFields.name: send
inputFields.description: send represents input parameters required when the message type is `send`.

types.name: TransactionFilter
types.description: Filters for querying Transactions within specified criteria related to their execution and placement within Blocks.

inputFields.name: from_block_height
inputFields.description: Minimum block height from which to start fetching Transactions, inclusive. Aids in scoping the search to recent Transactions.

inputFields.name: to_block_height
inputFields.description: Maximum block height up to which Transactions should be fetched, exclusive. Helps in limiting the search to older Transactions.

inputFields.name: from_index
inputFields.description: Minimum Transaction index from which to start fetching, inclusive. Facilitates ordering in Transaction queries.

inputFields.name: to_index
inputFields.description: Maximum Transaction index up to which to fetch, exclusive. Ensures a limit on the ordering range for Transaction queries.

inputFields.name: from_gas_wanted
inputFields.description: Minimum `gas_wanted` value to filter Transactions by, inclusive. Filters Transactions based on the minimum computational effort declared.

inputFields.name: to_gas_wanted
inputFields.description: Maximum `gas_wanted` value for filtering Transactions, exclusive. Limits Transactions based on the declared computational effort.

inputFields.name: from_gas_used
inputFields.description: Minimum `gas_used` value to filter Transactions by, inclusive. Selects Transactions based on the minimum computational effort actually used.

inputFields.name: to_gas_used
inputFields.description: Maximum `gas_used` value for filtering Transactions, exclusive. Refines selection based on the computational effort actually consumed.

inputFields.name: hash
inputFields.description: Hash from Transaction content in base64 encoding. If this filter is used, any other filter will be ignored.

inputFields.name: message
inputFields.description:
Transaction's message to filter Transactions.
`message` can be configured as a filter with a transaction message's `router` and `type` and `parameters(bank / vm)`.

inputFields.name: memo
inputFields.description:
`memo` are string information stored within a transaction.
`memo` can be utilized to find or distinguish transactions.
For example, when trading a specific exchange, you would utilize the memo field of the transaction.

inputFields.name: success
inputFields.description:
`success` is whether the transaction was successful or not.
`success` enables you to filter between successful and unsuccessful transactions.

fields.name: typeUrl
fields.description:
The type of transaction message.
The value of `typeUrl` can be `send`, `exec`, `add_package`, `run`.

fields.name: route
fields.description:
The route of transaction message.
The value of `route` can be `bank`, `vm`.

fields.name: value
fields.description:
MessageValue is the content of the transaction.
`value` can be of type `BankMsgSend`, `MsgCall`, `MsgAddPackage`, `MsgRun`, `UnexpectedMessage`.

types.name: TransactionMessageInput
types.description:
Transaction's message to filter Transactions.
`TransactionMessageInput` can be configured as a filter with a transaction message's `router` and `type` and `parameters(bank / vm)`.

inputFields.name: type_url
inputFields.description:
The type of transaction message.
The value of `typeUrl` can be `send`, `exec`, `add_package`, `run`.

inputFields.name: route
inputFields.description:
The route of transaction message.
The value of `route` can be `bank`, `vm`.

inputFields.name: bank_param
inputFields.description: `TransactionBankMessageInput` represents input parameters required when the message router is `bank`.

inputFields.name: vm_param
inputFields.description: `TransactionVmMessageInput` represents input parameters required when the message router is `vm`.

types.name: TransactionResponse
types.description:
`TransactionResponse` is the processing result of the transaction.
It has `log`, `info`, `error`, and `data`.

fields.name: log
fields.description: The log value associated with the Transaction execution, if any.

fields.name: info
fields.description: The Info associated with the Transaction execution, if any.

fields.name: error
fields.description: The error value associated with the Transaction execution, if any.

fields.name: data
fields.description: The response data associated with the Transaction execution, if any.

types.name: TransactionVmMessageInput
types.description: `TransactionVmMessageInput` represents input parameters required when the message router is `vm`.

inputFields.name: exec
inputFields.description: `MsgCallInput` represents input parameters required when the message type is `exec`.

inputFields.name: add_package
inputFields.description: `MsgAddPackageInput` represents input parameters required when the message type is `add_package`.

inputFields.name: run
inputFields.description: `MsgRunInput` represents input parameters required when the message type is `run`.

fields.name: gas_wanted
fields.description: gas limit

fields.name: gas_fee
fields.description: gas fee details (<value><denomination>)

types.name: UnexpectedMessage
types.description: `UnexpectedMessage` is an Undefined Message, which is a message that decoding failed.

directives.name: defer
directives.description: The @defer directive may be specified on a fragment spread to imply de-prioritization, that causes the fragment to be omitted in the initial response, and delivered as a subsequent response afterward. A query with @defer directive will cause the request to potentially return multiple responses, where non-deferred data is delivered in the initial response and data deferred delivered in a subsequent response. @include and @skip take precedence over @defer.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: The @deprecated built-in directive is used within the type system definition language to indicate deprecated portions of a GraphQL service's schema, such as deprecated fields on a type, arguments on a field, input fields on an input type, or values of an enum type.

directives.name: include
directives.description: The @include directive may be provided for fields, fragment spreads, and inline fragments, and allows for conditional inclusion during execution as described by the if argument.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: The @skip directive may be provided for fields, fragment spreads, and inline fragments, and allows for conditional exclusion during execution as described by the if argument.

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: The @specifiedBy built-in directive is used within the type system definition language to provide a scalar specification URL for specifying the behavior of custom scalar types.
